matrixhacker.algorithms.manifold.tsne module¶

t-SNE.

matrixhacker.algorithms.manifold.tsne.Hbeta(D=array([], dtype=float64), beta=1.0)¶

Compute the perplexity and the P-row for a specific value of the precision of a Gaussian distribution.

matrixhacker.algorithms.manifold.tsne.pca(X=array([], dtype=float64), no_dims=50)¶

Runs PCA on the NxD array X in order to reduce its dimensionality to no_dims dimensions.

matrixhacker.algorithms.manifold.tsne.tsne(X=array([], dtype=float64), no_dims=2, initial_dims=50, perplexity=30.0)¶

Runs t-SNE on the dataset in the NxD array X to reduce its dimensionality to no_dims dimensions. The syntaxis of the function is `Y = tsne.tsne(X, no_dims, perplexity), where X is an NxD NumPy array.

matrixhacker.algorithms.manifold.tsne.x2p(X=array([], dtype=float64), tol=1e-05, perplexity=30.0)¶

Performs a binary search to get P-values in such a way that each conditional Gaussian has the same perplexity.
